verse:
أَعُوذُ بِاللهِ مِنْ الشَّيْطَانِ الرَّجِيمِ
اللّهُ لاَ إِلَـهَ إِلاَّ هُوَ الْحَيُّ الْقَيُّومُ لاَ تَأْخُذُهُ سِنَةٌ وَلاَ نَوْمٌ لَّهُ مَا فِي السَّمَاوَاتِ وَمَا فِي الأَرْضِ مَن ذَا الَّذِي يَشْفَعُ عِنْدَهُ إِلاَّ بِإِذْنِهِ يَعْلَمُ مَا بَيْنَ أَيْدِيهِمْ وَمَا خَلْفَهُمْ وَلاَ يُحِيطُونَ بِشَيْءٍ مِّنْ عِلْمِهِ إِلاَّ بِمَا شَاء وَسِعَ كُرْسِيُّهُ السَّمَاوَاتِ وَالأَرْضَ وَلاَ يَؤُودُهُ حِفْظُهُمَا وَهُوَ الْعَلِيُّ الْعَظِيمُ
Eng_trans: A'udhu billahi min ash-shaytanir-rajim. Allahu la ilaha illa Huwa Al-Hayyul-Qayyum. La ta'khudhuhu sinatun wa la nawm. Lahu ma fis-samawati wa ma fil-ardi. Man tha alladhi yashfa'u 'indahu illa bi-idhnihi. Ya'lamu ma bayna aydihim wa ma khalfahum, wa la yuhituna bishay'in min 'ilmihi illa bima sha'a. Wasi'a kursiyyuhus-samawati wal-arda, wa la ya'uduhu hifdhuhuma, wa Huwal-'Aliyyul-'Azim.
Tafsir: I seek refuge in Allah from the accursed Satan. Allah! There is no deity except Him, the Ever-Living, the Sustainer of [all] existence. Neither drowsiness overtakes Him nor sleep. To Him belongs whatever is in the heavens and whatever is on the earth. Who is it that can intercede with Him except by His permission? He knows what is [presently] before them and what will be after them, and they encompass not a thing of His knowledge except for what He wills. His Kursi extends over the heavens and the earth, and their preservation tires Him not. And He is the Most High, the Most Great.
Author: — An-Nasa’ey & Ibn Hibban

verse:
بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمنِ الرَّحِيم
قُلْ هُوَ اللَّهُ أَحَدٌ، اللَّهُ الصَّمَدُ، لَمْ يَلِدْ وَلَمْ يُولَدْ، وَلَمْ يَكُن لَّهُۥ كُفُوًا أَحَد
Eng_trans: Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem. Qul Huwa Allahu Ahad, Allahus-Samad, Lam yalid wa lam yoolad, wa lam yakun lahu kufuwan ahad.
Tafsir: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, "He is Allah, [who is] One, Allah, the Eternal Refuge. He neither begets nor is born, Nor is there to Him any equivalent."
Author: — Abu Dawud, An-Nasa’ey & At-Tirmidhi

verse:
بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمنِ الرَّحِيم
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ الْفَلَقِ، مِن شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ، وَمِن شَرِّ غَاسِقٍ إِذَا وَقَبَ، وَمِن شَرِّ النَّفَّٰثَٰتِ فِى الْعُقَدِ، وَمِن شَرِّ حَاسِدٍ إِذَا حَسَدَ
Eng_trans: Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem. Qul a'udhu birabbil-falaq, min sharri ma khalaq, wa min sharri ghasiqin iza waqab, wa min sharri an-naffathati fil-'uqad, wa min sharri hasidin iza hasad.
Tafsir: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of the morning, From the evil of that which He created, And from the evil of darkness when it settles, And from the evil of the blowers in knots, And from the evil of an envier when he envies."
Author: — Abu Dawud, An-Nasa’ey & At-Tirmidhi

verse:
بِسْمِ اللهِ الرَّحْمنِ الرَّحِيم
قُلْ أَعُوذُ بِرَبِّ النَّاسِ، مَلِكِ النَّاسِ، إِلَٰهِ النَّاسِ،مِن شَرِّ الْوَسْوَاسِ الْخَنَّاسِ،الَّذِى يُوَسْوِسُ فِى صُدُورِ النَّاسِ، مِنَ الْجِنَّةِ وَالنَّاسِ
Eng_trans: Bismillahir-Rahmanir-Raheem. Qul a'udhu birabbin-nas, malikin-nas, ilahin-nas, min sharri al-waswasil-khannas, alladhi yuwaswisu fee sudurin-nas, minal-jinnati wan-nas.
Tafsir: In the name of Allah, the Most Gracious, the Most Merciful. Say, "I seek refuge in the Lord of mankind, The Sovereign of mankind, The God of mankind, From the evil of the retreating whisperer - Who whispers [evil] into the breasts of mankind - From among the jinn and mankind."
Author: — Abu Dawud, An-Nasa’ey & At-Tirmidhi

verse: اللَّهُمَّ أَنْتَ رَبِّي لاَ إِلَهَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ خَلَقْتَنِي وَأَنَا عَبْدُكَ، وَأَنَا عَلَى عَهْدِكَ وَوَعْدِكَ مَا اسْتَطَعْتُ، أَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا صَنَعْتُ، أَبُوءُ لَكَ بِنِعْمَتِكَ عَلَيَّ وَأَبُوءُ بِذَنْبِي فَاغْفِرْ لِي فَإِنَّهُ لاَ يَغْفِرُ الذُّنُوبَ إِلاَّ أَنْتَ
Eng_trans: Allahumma anta rabbii la ilaha illa anta khalaqtani wa ana 'abdukka, wa ana 'ala 'ahdika wa wa'dika ma istat'at, a'udhu bika min sharri ma san'at, abu'u laka bi ni'matika 'alayya wa abu'u bi dhanbi faighfir li fa innahu la yaghfirudh-dhunuba illa anta.
Tafsir: O Allah, You are my Lord, there is no deity except You. You created me and I am Your servant, and I abide to Your covenant and promise as best I can. I seek refuge in You from the evil of what I have done. I acknowledge Your favor upon me and I acknowledge my sin, so forgive me, for verily none can forgive sins except You.
Author: — Al-Bukhari

verse: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أسْـأَلُـكَ العَـفْوَ وَالعـافِـيةَ في الدُّنْـيا وَالآخِـرَة ، اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أسْـأَلُـكَ العَـفْوَ وَالعـافِـيةَ في ديني وَدُنْـيايَ وَأهْـلي وَمالـي ، اللّهُـمَّ اسْتُـرْ عـوْراتي وَآمِـنْ رَوْعاتـي ، اللّهُـمَّ احْفَظْـني مِن بَـينِ يَدَيَّ وَمِن خَلْفـي وَعَن يَمـيني وَعَن شِمـالي ، وَمِن فَوْقـي ، وَأَعـوذُ بِعَظَمَـتِكَ أَن أُغْـتالَ مِن تَحْتـي
Eng_trans: Allahumma inni as'aluka al-'afwa wal-'afiyata fid-dunya wal-akhirah, Allahumma inni as'aluka al-'afwa wal-'afiyata fi deeni wa dunyaya wa ahli wa mali, Allahumma astur 'awraati wa amin raw'ati, Allahumma ihfazni min bayni yadayya wa min khalfii wa 'an yamini wa 'an shimali, wa min fawqi, wa a'udhu bi 'azamatika an ughtala min tahti.
Tafsir: O Allah, I ask You for forgiveness and well-being in this world and the Hereafter. O Allah, I ask You for forgiveness and well-being in my religion, my worldly life, my family, and my wealth. O Allah, cover my faults and calm my fears. O Allah, protect me from in front of me, from behind me, from my right, from my left, and from above me. And I seek refuge in Your Greatness from being taken unaware from beneath me.
Author: — Abu Dawud & Ibn Majah

verse: اللّهُـمَّ عالِـمَ الغَـيْبِ وَالشّـهادَةِ فاطِـرَ السّماواتِ وَالأرْضِ رَبَّ كـلِّ شَـيءٍ وَمَليـكَه ، أَشْهَـدُ أَنْ لا إِلـهَ إِلاّ أَنْت ، أَعـوذُ بِكَ مِن شَـرِّ نَفْسـي وَمِن شَـرِّ الشَّيْـطانِ وَشِرْكِهِ ، وَأَنْ أَقْتَـرِفَ عَلـى نَفْسـي سوءاً أَوْ أَجُـرَّهُ إِلـى مُسْـلِم
Eng_trans: Allahumma 'alimal-ghaybi wash-shahadati fatiras-samawati wal-ardi rabba kulli shay'in wa malikah, ash-hadu an la ilaha illa anta, a'udhu bika min sharri nafsi wa min sharri ash-shaytani wa shirkihi, wa an aqtarifa 'ala nafsi su'an aw ajurrahulaa muslim.
Tafsir: O Allah, Knower of the unseen and the witnessed, Originator of the heavens and the earth, Lord and Sovereign of all things. I bear witness that there is no deity except You. I seek refuge in You from the evil of my own self and from the evil of Satan and his association, and from committing wrong against myself or bringing it upon a Muslim.
Author: — Abu Dawud & At-Tirmidhi

verse: أَمْسَيْنا وَأَمْسَى الْمُلْكُ للهِ رَبِّ الْعَالَمَيْنِ، اللَّهُمَّ إِنَّي أسْأَلُكَ خَيْرَ هَذَه اللَّيْلَةِ فَتْحَهَا ونَصْرَهَا، ونُوْرَهَا وبَرَكَتهَا، وَهُدَاهَا، وَأَعُوذُ بِكَ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا فيهِا وَشَرَّ مَا بَعْدَهَا
Eng_trans: Amsayna wa amsal-mulku lillahi rabbi al-'alamin, Allahumma inni as'aluka khayra hadhal-laylati fat'haaha wa nasraha, wa nooraha wa barakataha, wa hudaha, wa a'udhu bika min sharri ma feeha wa sharra ma ba'daha.
Tafsir: As we reach the evening and the kingdom belongs to Allah, Lord of the worlds, O Allah, I ask You for the good of this night: its opening, its victory, its light, its blessings, and its guidance. And I seek refuge in You from the evil within it and the evil that follows it.
Author: — Abu Dawud

verse: أَمْسَيْنَا وَأَمْسَى الْمُلْكُ لِلَّهِ، وَالْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ، لَا إِلَهَ إِلَّا اللَّهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءٍ قَدِيرٌ
Eng_trans: Amsayna wa amsal-mulku lillah, walhamdu lillah, la ilaha illallahu wahdahu la shareeka lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamd, wa Huwa 'ala kulli shay'in Qadeer
Tafsir: We have reached the evening and the kingdom belongs to Allah. All praise is for Allah. None has the right to be worshipped except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent.
Author: — Abu Dawud & Muslim

verse: أَمْسَيْنَا عَلَى فِطْرَةِ الإسْلاَمِ، وَعَلَى كَلِمَةِ الإِخْلاَصِ، وَعَلَى دِينِ نَبِيِّنَا مُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ، وَعَلَى مِلَّةِ أَبِينَا إبْرَاهِيمَ حَنِيفاً مُسْلِماً وَمَا كَانَ مِنَ المُشْرِكِينَ
Eng_trans: Amsayna 'ala fitratil-Islam, wa 'ala kalimatil-ikhlas, wa 'ala deeni nabiyyina Muhammad sallallahu 'alayhi wa sallam, wa 'ala millati abina Ibrahim hanifan musliman wa ma kana minal-mushrikeen.
Tafsir: We have reached the evening upon the natural religion of Islam, upon the word of sincerity, upon the religion of our Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), and upon the faith of our father Abraham, upright and a Muslim, and he was not of the polytheists.
Author: — Ahmed & At-Tirmidhi

verse: اللَّهُمَّ بِكَ أَمْسَيْنَا، وَبِكَ أَصْبَحْنَا، وَبِكَ نَحْيَا، وَبِكَ نَمُوتُ، وَإِلَيْكَ الْمَصِيرُ
Eng_trans: Allahumma bika amsayna, wa bika asbahna, wa bika nahya, wa bika namootu, wa ilaykal-maseer
Tafsir: O Allah, by Your leave we have reached the evening and by Your leave we have reached the morning, by Your leave we live and die and unto You is our return.
Author: — At-Tirmidhi & Abu Dawud

verse: اللّهُـمَّ إِنِّـي أَمسيتُ أُشْـهِدُك ، وَأُشْـهِدُ حَمَلَـةَ عَـرْشِـك ، وَمَلَائِكَتَكَ ، وَجَمـيعَ خَلْـقِك ، أَنَّـكَ أَنْـتَ اللهُ لا إلهَ إلاّ أَنْـتَ وَحْـدَكَ لا شَريكَ لَـك ، وَأَنَّ ُ مُحَمّـداً عَبْـدُكَ وَرَسـولُـك
Eng_trans: Allahumma inni amsaytu ush-hiduka, wa ush-hidu hamalata 'arshika, wa mala'ikataka, wa jami'a khalqika, annaka anta Allahu la ilaha illa anta wahdaka la sharika laka, wa anna Muhammadan 'abduka wa rasuluk.
Tafsir: O Allah, verily I have reached the evening and I bear witness to You, and I bear witness to the carriers of Your Throne, and to Your angels, and to all of Your creation, that You are Allah, there is no deity except You alone, without partner, and that Muhammad is Your servant and Your Messenger.
Author: — Abu Dawud

verse: اللّهُـمَّ ما أَمسى بي مِـنْ نِعْـمَةٍ أَو بِأَحَـدٍ مِـنْ خَلْـقِك ، فَمِـنْكَ وَحْـدَكَ لا شريكَ لَـك ، فَلَـكَ الْحَمْـدُ وَلَـكَ الشُّكْـر
Eng_trans: Allahumma ma amsa bee min ni'matin aw bi ahadin min khalqika, faminka wahdaka la sharika laka, falakal-hamdu walakash-shukr.
Tafsir: O Allah, whatever blessing has been received by me or by any of Your creation this evening, is from You alone, without partner. So all praise and thanks are for You.
Author: — Abu Dawud

verse: يَا رَبِّ , لَكَ الْحَمْدُ كَمَا يَنْبَغِي لِجَلَالِ وَجْهِكَ , وَلِعَظِيمِ سُلْطَانِكَ
Eng_trans: Ya Rabb, laka al-hamdu kama yanbaghi lijalali wajhika, wa li'azimi sultanika.
Tafsir: O Lord, all praise is for You as is befitting to the majesty of Your Face and the greatness of Your Authority.
Author: — Ibn Majah

verse: حَسْبِـيَ اللّهُ لا إلهَ إلاّ هُوَ عَلَـيهِ تَوَكَّـلتُ وَهُوَ رَبُّ العَرْشِ العَظـيم
Eng_trans: Hasbiyallahu la ilaha illa Huwa 'alayhi tawakkaltu wa Huwa rabbul-'arshil-'azim.
Tafsir: Allah is sufficient for me, there is no deity except Him. I have put my trust in Him, and He is the Lord of the mighty throne.
Author: — Abu Dawud

verse: أَعُوذُ بِكَلِمَاتِ اللَّهِ التَّامَّاتِ مِنْ شَرِّ مَا خَلَقَ
Eng_trans: A'udhu bikalimatil-lahit-tammati min sharri ma khalaq
Tafsir: I seek refuge in Allah's perfect words from the evil of what He has created.
Author: — Muslim

verse: بِسْمِ اللَّهِ الَّذِي لَا يَضُرُّ مَعَ اسْمِهِ شَيْءٌ فِي الْأَرْضِ وَلَا فِي السَّمَاءِ وَهُوَ السَّمِيعُ الْعَلِيمُ
Eng_trans: Bismillahil-ladhi la yadurru ma'asmihi shay'un fil-ardi wa la fis-sama'i wa Huwas-Sami'ul-'Aleem
Tafsir: In the name of Allah with whose name nothing is harmed on earth nor in the heavens, and He is The All-Hearing, The All-Knowing.
Author: — Abu Dawud, At-Tirmidhi

verse: رَضِيتُ بِاللَّهِ رَبًّا، وَبِالْإِسْلَامِ دِينًا، وَبِمُحَمَّدٍ صَلَّى اللَّهُ عَلَيْهِ وَسَلَّمَ نَبِيًّا
Eng_trans: Raditu billahi rabban, wabil-islami deenan, wabimuhammadin sallallahu 'alayhi wa sallam nabeeyaa
Tafsir: I am pleased with Allah as my Lord, with Islam as my religion, and with Muhammad (peace be upon him) as my Prophet.
Author: — Abu Dawud, At-Tirmidhi

verse: سبْحـانَ اللهِ وَبِحَمْـدِهِ عَدَدَ خَلْـقِه ، وَرِضـا نَفْسِـه ، وَزِنَـةَ عَـرْشِـه ، وَمِـدادَ كَلِمـاتِـه
Eng_trans: Subhanallahi wa bihamdihi 'adada khalqihi, wa ridaa nafsihi, wa zinata 'arshihi, wa midada kalimatihi.
Tafsir: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him, by the multitude of His creation, by His pleasure, by the weight of His Throne, and by the extent of His words.
Author: — Muslim

verse:
اللّهُـمَّ عافِـني في بَدَنـي ، اللّهُـمَّ عافِـني في سَمْـعي ، اللّهُـمَّ عافِـني في بَصَـري ، لا إلهَ إلاّ أَنْـتَ
اللّهُـمَّ إِنّـي أَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنَ الْكُـفر ، وَالفَـقْر ، وَأَعـوذُ بِكَ مِنْ عَذابِ القَـبْر ، لا إلهَ إلاّ أَنْـتَ
Eng_trans: Allahumma 'aafini fi badani, Allahumma 'aafini fi sam'i, Allahumma 'aafini fi basari, la ilaha illa anta. Allahumma inni a'udhu bika minal-kufri, wal-faqr, wa a'udhu bika min 'adhabil-qabr, la ilaha illa anta.
Tafsir: O Allah, grant health to my body, O Allah, grant health to my hearing, O Allah, grant health to my sight. There is no deity except You. O Allah, I seek refuge in You from disbelief and poverty, and I seek refuge in You from the punishment of the grave. There is no deity except You.
Author: — Abu Dawud

verse: يَا حَيُّ يَا قيُّومُ بِرَحْمَتِكَ أسْتَغِيثُ أصْلِحْ لِي شَأنِي كُلَّهُ وَلاَ تَكِلْنِي إلَى نَفْسِي طَـرْفَةَ عَيْنٍ
Eng_trans: Ya Hayyu Ya Qayyum, birahmatika astagheeth, aslih li sha'ni kullahu wa la takilni ila nafsi tarfata 'ayn.
Tafsir: O Allah, O Ever-Living, O Sustainer, by Your mercy I seek help. Rectify for me all of my affairs and do not entrust me to myself even for the blink of an eye.
Author: — An-Nasa’ey

verse: اللَّهُمَّ صَلِّ وَسَلِّمْ وَبَارِكْ على نَبِيِّنَا مُحمَّد
Eng_trans: Allahumma salli wa sallim wa barik 'ala nabiyyina Muhammad.
Tafsir: O Allah, send Your prayers, peace, and blessings upon our Prophet Muhammad.
Author: — At-Tabarani

verse: لَا إلَه إلّا اللهُ وَحْدَهُ لَا شَرِيكَ لَهُ، لَهُ الْمُلْكُ وَلَهُ الْحَمْدُ وَهُوَ عَلَى كُلِّ شَيْءِ قَدِيرِ
Eng_trans: La ilaha illallahu wahdahu la shareeka lah, lahul-mulku wa lahul-hamd, wa Huwa 'ala kulli shay'in Qadeer.
Tafsir: There is no deity except Allah, alone, without partner. To Him belongs all sovereignty and praise, and He is over all things omnipotent.
Author: — Muslim

verse: سُبْحَانَ اللَّهِ وَبِحَمْدِهِ
Eng_trans: Subhanallah wa bihamdihi
Tafsir: Glory is to Allah and praise is to Him.
Author: — Muslim

verse: أسْتَغْفِرُ اللهَ وَأتُوبُ إلَيْهِ
Eng_trans: Astaghfirullah wa atubu ilayhi
Tafsir: I seek forgiveness from Allah and turn to Him in repentance.
Author: — Al-Bukhari & Muslim
